column1: Programming for Complete Beginners in C#

column2: An object is the root of all types (so everything inherently is an object)
String is a sequence of Unicode characters. String data is represented by double quotes
Floats and doubles are floating point values, which means they are not perfectly precise
Unsigned = only positive numbers. Example = uint vs. int
Custom types, like classes, will contain data (fields) and behavior (methods)
Type is a template for creating data structures
C# program is conceptually a set of type declarations and workflows
